text: Yun Seon-do (; June 22, 1587 June 11, 1671) was a Korean politician, philosopher, and poet during the Joseon Dynasty. He was also called Gosan (고산, 孤山), Haeong (해옹, 海翁), or Yaki (약이, 約而). == Works == * Gosanseonsaengyugo (고산선생유고, 孤山先生遺稿) * Byeoljip (별집, 別集) * Yakhwaje (약화제, 藥和劑) * Seonchangyak (선창약, 癬瘡藥) * Hwaechungyak (회충약, 蛔蟲藥) * Haesuyak (해수약, 咳嗽藥) * Bokhaksinbang (복학신방, 腹학神方) * Uyeoksinbang (우역신방, 牛疫神方) * Oseonjubang (오선주방, 五仙酒方) ==Related pages== * Heo Mok * Yun Hyu * Jeong Gu * Song Siyeol * Jeong Yak-yong == Other websites == * http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=123646 * http://people.aks.ac.kr/front/tabCon/ppl/pplView.aks?pplId=PPL_6JOb_A1587_1_0008531 * http://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=689760 * http://navercast.naver.com/contents.nhn?contents_id=465 Category:1587 births Category:1671 deaths Category:Korean politicians Category:Korean autobiographers Category:Korean poets
title: Yun Seon-do
